snippet: Some of Spain’s largest financial institutions are fretting about the potential impact of a rescue plan that would allow banks to transfer toxic assets to a government-backed agency.
abstract: Some of Spain’s largest financial institutions are fretting about the potential impact of a rescue plan that would allow banks to transfer toxic assets to a government-backed agency; they fear a bailout would hurt their valuations; many economists believe keeping afloat the most troubled banks will require fresh capital rather than more mergers and cost cutting.
lead_paragraph: Some of Spain’s largest financial institutions are fretting about the potential impact of a rescue plan that would allow banks to transfer toxic assets to a government-backed agency.

headline.main: Spanish Banks Resist Idea of ‘Bad Bank’ Bailout
headline.print_headline: Spain’s Largest Banks Fear a Federal Bailout Could Hurt Their Valuations
